text: Can pour. Pours a hazy yellow amber. Light bodied with some bitterness on the finish. Smooth. Refreshing.

On tap at the brewery in a tulip glass: This is stupid good for the ABV. Pours hazy golden with a one finger head. Aroma of peach, grapes, pineapple, and light cat piss. Taste is a perfect balance of sweetness, citrus, and hop bitterness. Just a really drinkable IPA with no trace of booze and tons of flavor. Its fantastic.
Hazy yellow orange. Aroma and flavor explode with stone fruit, tropical kiwi mango and citrus rind, all in a crushable 5.8%. One of my favorite pale ales for sure!

Pours a hazy yellow/orange with a white head. Little bird but big flavor. Citrus aroma, crisp easy drinking pale ale 

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

7/XII/16 - 1Pt. can @ Yet Another Trillium Tasting (home) - BB: n/a, canned: 9/IX/16 (2016-1447) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the can!
Cloudy pale orange to beige beer, small creamy to aery off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bit malty, grains, grassy, little fruity. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity, sweet start, lots of citrus, bit malty, lots of grapefruit, some pineapple, little sourish. Aftertaste: very fruity, lovely bitterness, more grapefruit, very nice one!
Can at tderoecks place, thanks for sharing! Onions? Some citrus but weard smell. Light bitter, orange, nice!
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a small sized head. Fruity / tropical fruits, citrus, and some toastiness.

Tasted on 10/17/16 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex for this one. Pours cloudy, very bright, almost like a neon orange, with a thick, rocky white head that slowly recedes to thick lace. The nose is really aromatic, a great blend of dried orange peel, citrus blossom, a nice earthy herbal note, with just a tinge of pineapple. The flavor is really nice and juicy orange up front, moving to the more herbal orange peel and slightly green herbal note, with a very faint hint of bitterness. The body is medium, with a great texture, plenty of acidity to make my mouth water, average carbonation, and a long hint of bitter herbal orange peel finish.

16oz can thanks to Rick. Pours out a hazy peach color topped with a white head. Nose is tropical fruit melon some citrus notes and sweetness. Taste is more of the tropical fruit notes melon and sweet malt.

500mL can, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours an opaque cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out fresh mangoes and papayas, a little orange, and piney hops. Flavour bursts of tropical fruitiness, particularly peach and citrus, with fairly bitter piney hops and just enough dry biscuity malt. Dry, somewhat astringent but bright finish. Exceedingly drinkable and fresh. Excellent.
Can shared with the DB crew. Milky golden pour with a generous head. Notes of stone fruit, juicy hops, mangoes, sticky and a light mellow bitterness.

Can. Pours a fairly clear yellow/gold with a thin bubbly white head. Aromas of citrus, peach, and kiwi is def there as well. Flavor had some orange, lemon, peach, kiwi. Light body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, creeping bitterness to finish. Crisp, refreshing, easy drinking.

Can shades at a secret location. 
Pour real cloudy milky light yellow, with a small white head. 
Aroma of citrus, citra, slight grass. To me, this has some white pebber to it, like In a saison. 
Taste is slightly bitter with a faint sweet note it. Medium bodied, with a perfect amount of flat carbonation. Thanks for sharing

Pours hazy milky yellow with a white head. Aroma of big juicy fruits, stone fruits, dank hops, peach and awesome tropical notes. The taste is dank and hoppy with tropical juicy fruits, orange, grapefruit, minty bubblegum and a rather minty end.
Can. Pours juicy thick yellow with a small white head. Aromas of dank hops, pineapple, citrus, minty. Taste is dank, peppery, melon, pineapple, citrus, peach, papaya.
(can) cloudy yellow colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of lemon, grapefruit, hint of honey; light, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; lightly creamy palate

Can 1 pt. Pours a cloudy, opaque almost murky orange golden with a small, white head. Heavily dank aroma, clearly loads of dryhopping. Medium body, carbonation to the low side, fruity but fairly dry before an intense hop soup ending. A very trendy Pale Ale style! 280916

16 oz. can. Hazy, almost murky, orange. Aroma has peaches and a soft sweet fruitiness. Just a bit of garlic. Tastes much less sweet. Still has a little of the peach flavor, but a lot more garlic with a moderate bitterness. Medium light. Soft carbonation. Excellent pale ale without being remarkable.

16 oz can poured into a tulip. Thanks Tyler! Murky brownish yellow with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, garlic, onion. Tastes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral. Medium body with a dry finish.

Can. Incredibly hazy. Huge pineapple and dankness in the nose. Nice juicy creamy mouthfeel that leaves the tongue somewhat dry. Balanced and complex for the style. Incredibly fruity finish. Underrated

Fresh can right from the source. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Fruity hop bouquet. Kinda wacky, its not watery but its light. The hops are bitter but theyre not. Muted kiwi and bisquit notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

Growler shared by Mike. It pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma has some stone fruit and citrus. Juicy. The flavor has more of a grapefruit passionfruit thing going on. Pretty muddy in appearance, but the mouthfeel doesnt seem to be affected negatively IMO. Crushable.
Can thanks to Brandon. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is floral, dust, pineapple. Medium body, juicy hop, pineapple, melon, dank, crushable, very nice.

The commercial description above pretty much covers all of the tasting notes I could possibly give this. Its like a more bitter version of Tree Houses Julius, with a ton of turbid haziness and the aroma of a fresh glass of orange juice.
Extremely well-made and integrated pale ale. A bit different from the Fort Point series in that this is a bit lighter on the palate yet less masking of the bitterness. Fantastic.

Growler with thanks to bparker551! Pours very cloudy Arnold Palmer, small white head, dissipates pretty quickly, good lacing anyway. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, some tropical notes, mango, dank dark wet leaves. Flavor is very light sweet, dry, light bitter, not harsh at all; crushable to the extreme. Light plus body. Solid beer.

Pours a hazy yellow-gold color with a medium bone white head that dissipates gradually to a film. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of tropical fruit, hops, malt and a bit of green onion. Light to medium body with flavors of grapefruity hops, peach, and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering tropical fruit and hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Growler filled 7/22/16, drunk 7/27/16.Heavily hazy, dark copper tinted golden is topped by a strong, white head.Great hop combo shows off peach, pear, nectarine, white grape, spicy pineapple-mango and dank notes with a good dose of malt backing. Biscuity malts and oats, with some caramel-tinged grain suggestions from the crystal malt. It doesnt detract from the hops, though there is some slightly dull character, be it too much yeast (highly unlikely) or the particulate. No alcohol or flaw. Certainly juicy and enjoyable nose, though not quite as extensively lush and juicy as some of their best.The flavors I like less than the nose, mostly on account of a strong graininess that must be the caramel/crystal malt. That or whatever is dulling the aroma slightly, is showing up even more in the flavor. Just a bland, nutty, almost bready character. Its not heavy or hugely disruptive, but its enough to dampen the brightness and juiciness and cut at the soft, malty, finely-carbonated texture. Still a fantastic beer, however you look at it, but among my least favorite batches of any Small Bird Ive had.
Can dated 7/14. 10 days old. Aroma is huge pineapple, white grapes, and grapefruit. Tastes amazing. Dank, citrus and pineapple all balanced perfectly. Mild bitterness. So smooth. I want more.

16 oz.can shared by ClarkVV. Aroma of bold citrus,grass and melons.
The flavor shows a solid amount of Galaxy type hops in a pale mat and wheat backbone. Average texture in a lighter body. 
This doesnt make my cock flaccid at all! The level of flavor for the gravity is awesome!

16oz can from ClarkVV. Ive been roostered. Thanks, Clark. Pours cloudy straw with an off white head. Smells like a glass full of mosaic. Flavor follows. Tropical fruit, scallion. Nice and soft. A great small flaccid cock from Trillium.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2016 Poured from can thanks ClarkVV hazy lemon with a thin white head. Aromas of orange mango and scallion. Taste is citrus dank pine hops pineapple and scallion. Huge penetrating flavors from such a tiny flaccid cock.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Tap at the source, Canton. Pours typical hazy grapefruit golden fruit juice. Aroma is gorgeous sweet orange and mango. Tropical notes galore. Sweet and juicy. Flavor is oooh, pine, orange, pineapple, slightly dank, grapefruit, tropical. Nice.

Can from fort point. Pours hazy golden yellow, white head. Aroma is spicy rye, cat piss, grass, grapefruit, melon, kiwi, wheat, citrus fruits and spice. Flavor is light and fuzzy tropical peach, white grape, grass, pissy melon, spicy rye notes and bitter finish. Intensely complex beer for the ABV and style, very much enjoyed carefully chugging this can on Amtrak.
Fresh can from Lee. Pours murky yellow golden with small white head. Notes are minerals, tasty water, kiwi, light tangy hop, and grass. Really light and clean hop juice. Excellent

Opaque grapefruit color, which is normal for Trillium but still a little unsettling. But a beautiful big white head actually makes the beer attractive. Great aroma, of grapefruit, kiwi, honeysuckle, mandarin orange, grape, particularly concord grape. Woah. Flavor of grapefruit, orange, with notes of grape. Great smooth body, like a wheat ale without the wheat! Delicious.
Outstanding pale ale that was surprisingly delicious. Tons of juicy citrus and tropical fruit hops balanced by a spicy rye and light caramel malty backbone. Lightly bitter and relatively dry.

Super tasty pale ale, complex hop flavor and drinkable like hell. I wouldve had 2 or 3 more pints of this. I had to go to trillium to get a growler of fort point, cant wait to try that one. Great beer, hillfarmsteadesque
On draft, another amazing hoppy pale ale with a light rye spice ness in the background, fantastic stuff

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet yeast and caramel aromas. Soft with summer meadow, hay and yeast upfront turning to mild bitter pith in the lasting finish.

32oz growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of citrusy, spicy, and piney hops, plus a nice caramel and pale maltiness, and a little wheat/rye. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average texture. A really good beer.

Tap. Big fresh juicy passion fruit. Juicy oranges. Hint of resin. Wheat and rye malt backing is really nice.clean. awesome balance between juicy semi sweet oranges tangerines And passion fruit against a hoppy juicy pink grapefruit. Hunt of rustic resin and rye. Complex. Great.
